Tucson was hurting on every inch of his body.  There was nothing that did n=
ot ache or throb.  Yet, he makes no groans or expression of his agony.  He =
merely sighs heavilly to try and catch his breath.  He came to the realizat=
ion that if he is going to get out of his predicament in one piece he would=
 have to try a move that no one would ever dream he would try.  But Hydras =
and the others have seemed to have caught onto him, including Zarak.  He ha=
d already scanned him and found his schematics out.  Now, they wanted to qu=
estion him.  Though battered and dented and in a state of disrepair, the th=
ought of them trying to get him to answer their questions so that they coul=
d use him for their own evil gain, that was definitely not going to fly wit=
h him.

Through all his damages, he finds himself still able to get on his =
knees to assume a transforming position, and then painfully transforms into=
 his SUV mode. 

" You - forgot - something.  My - engine - is still - in t=
act." 

He puts himself into drive and screeches his back tires, now daring=
 to make a move on wheels.  Smoke from  his duel exhaust system fills the r=
oom and even though it was painful to roll his tires, he keeps at it, to tr=
y and fill the room with a bit of a smoke screen.  He was adept in these co=
nditions because he couldn't see anything anyway. Before moving he makes su=
re he fills the room with enough smoke to cloud things a bit.  He had to ma=
ke his move, because his energy reserves would not last him much longer. Hi=
s energon level drops dangerously low, yet he knew that maybe with what lit=
tle he had left, he could get out of there and hopefully gain a bit of grou=
nd away from the tower.  He uses his sonar systems to navigate around Rodim=
us,Scourge and Cyclonus, desperately looking for a way out.  But at the sam=
e time, he picks up another familliar signature.  Nightlight.  He comes to =
a screeching halt.  And now, finds that there is not enough fuel to get him=
self out of the tower.  He would have to remain where he was.  And in his p=
resent SUV mode.  

"N - Night - Nightlight...  Here...."  

His engine shu=
ts down.  Clearly there was not enough energy to make his escape, and he ha=
d not the heart to leave a comrade behind.  No matter if it were a Maximal =
or an Autobot.  His headlights dim, as his body now goes off line due to en=
ergy exhaustion.

ile you have been um . . . dealing with our intruder I have been keeping wa=

mounted scanners orients on Tuscon, "He does indeed have features that rese=
mble Prime." Zarak's voice speaks again, "Before you kill him, he might be =
